Section 1 - Department and Building Fund.q: What is the formal name of the department that you work for?
Section 1 - Department and Building Fund.a: Memorial Union and Student Pavilion Operations.

Section 1 - Department and Building Fund.q: There are four different student teams that work in the Memorial Union and Student Pavilion. One of these student areas are the Building Managers. Name the other three student teams.
Section 1 - Department and Building Fund.a: Event Assistants (EAs), Information Desk Staff, and Operations Aides.

Section 1 - Department and Building Fund.q: What is the required dress code for each student team?
Section 1 - Department and Building Fund.a: Each team follows the department’s professional dress standards, including designated uniforms or attire suitable for events and guest-facing operations.

Section 2 - Building and Shift Procedure.q: As a Building Manager, describe what should be done at the beginning of each shift?
Section 2 - Building and Shift Procedure.a: Check the shift report, complete a walkthrough, check spaces, communicate with staff, and prepare the building for operations.

Section 2 - Building and Shift Procedure.q: Describe the full opening procedures for the Memorial Union (MU).
Section 2 - Building and Shift Procedure.a: Unlock entrances, perform initial building checks, verify that event spaces are ready, ensure common areas are clean, and confirm operational readiness.

Section 2 - Building and Shift Procedure.q: Describe the full closing procedures for the Memorial Union (MU).
Section 2 - Building and Shift Procedure.a: Secure entrances, complete final building tours, check meeting spaces, common areas, and restrooms, ensure equipment is stored, and confirm all guests have left.

Section 2 - Building and Shift Procedure.q: Describe the full opening procedures for the Student Pavilion (STPV).
Section 2 - Building and Shift Procedure.a: Unlock entrances, check the Mall, ensure meeting spaces are ready, verify AV and lights are working, and confirm event setups.

Section 2 - Building and Shift Procedure.q: Describe the full closing procedures for the Student Pavilion (STPV).
Section 2 - Building and Shift Procedure.a: Secure entrances, perform final checks of meeting spaces, remove event signage, and ensure cleanliness of all common and reserved spaces.

Section 2 - Building and Shift Procedure.q: Name at least five things a Building Manager does or should be looking for during a building tour.
Section 2 - Building and Shift Procedure.a: Cleanliness, safety hazards, equipment functionality, setup accuracy, and guest issues or needs.

Section 3 - Emergency Management and Inc.q: Please describe what steps you would take as a Building Manager upon hearing an alarm go off in the building.
Section 3 - Emergency Management and Inc.a: Evacuate the building if necessary, guide guests outside, communicate with professional staff, and await official clearance before re-entry.

Section 3 - Emergency Management and Inc.q: If the building is evacuated, how do you know when to let the general public back inside the building?
Section 3 - Emergency Management and Inc.a: Only re-enter the building after receiving an 'all clear' from professional staff or emergency personnel.

Section 3 - Emergency Management and Inc.q:
Which of the following should you not do if you are inside the building and active shooting is taking place?
a. If safe, exit the building and call 9-11
b. If you cannot leave, secure your area
c. Yell for help
d. Silence your cell phones

In each of the following emergency incidents, highlight what actions you should take: document in shift report, complete incident report, submit maintenance work order, EMS notes, or contact professional staff/ASU PD.
Section 3 - Emergency Management and Inc.a: Depends on the situation: submit work orders for maintenance issues, complete incident reports for accidents or disruptions, contact EMS for medical emergencies, contact professional staff/ASU PD for serious incidents.

Section 4 - Student Pavilion and Memoria.q: True or False: The Building Manager is responsible for making sure the outdoor patio furniture is set neatly.
Name all of the offices (both service offices and dining options) that are located in the Memorial Union and Student Pavilion.
Section 4 - Student Pavilion and Memoria.a: Examples include Pitchforks, Qdoba, Chick-fil-A, Jamba Juice, P.O.D. Market, Starbucks, and the MU Administrative Offices.

Section 4 - Student Pavilion and Memoria.q:
Storage areas in each building should:
a. Be closed and locked at all times
b. Be kept clean, organized, and free of safety concerns
c. Be checked during building tours
d. All of the above

Section 5 - Quality Assurance.q:
Which of the following tasks is not completed prior to the arrival of a client for a reservation?
a. The room is set up per the Setup Notes and/or diagram
b. The room is clean, clear of trash or other miscellaneous items
c. The tables and chairs are clean and neatly set
d. The blinds of the room are of the same length.
e. Equipment is tested and is in working order
f. All of the above.
Section 5 - Quality Assurance.a: d. The blinds of the room are of the same length.

Section 5 - Quality Assurance.q: What do you do after an event or meeting ends in the meeting rooms at STPV?
Section 5 - Quality Assurance.a: Clear the room of trash, reset furniture if needed, and report any damages or issues.

Section 5 - Quality Assurance.q: True or False: The purpose of a facility tour is for the Building Manager to monitor, observe, and take appropriate action to ensure the building services and facilities meet the needs of the University community.
Where should trash be placed at the end of an event?
Section 5 - Quality Assurance.a: In designated trash bins or behind service doors if collected separately.

Section 6 - Administration: Shift Report.q: What is a Building Manager Shift Report and what is its purpose?
Section 6 - Administration: Shift Report.a: It documents building status, incidents, and maintenance needs to maintain continuity between shifts.

Section 6 - Administration: Shift Report.q: Where do you find the Building Manager Shift Report?
Section 6 - Administration: Shift Report.a: Accessible online via the designated operations portal or drive.

Section 6 - Administration: Shift Report.q: If you're opening, how do you create a new Shift Report for that day?
Section 6 - Administration: Shift Report.a: Create a new entry in the system for the current date.

Section 6 - Administration: Shift Report.q: What information should go in a Shift Report?
Section 6 - Administration: Shift Report.a: Building status, maintenance needs, incidents, shift notes, and important communications.

Section 6 - Administration: Shift Report.q: True or False: The shift report should be checked at the beginning of your shift to review any notes left by the previous Building Manager.

Section 7 - Administration: Incident and.q:
Maintenance work orders can be?
a. Submitted only via the online form
b. Submitted via telephone with professional staff
c. Submitted via telephone in the event of an emergency
d. B and C
Describe how you would submit a work order to have a maintenance issue addressed in the building (e.g., a spill, cleaning in a public area)?
Section 7 - Administration: Incident and.a: Submit through the online form or call professional staff if urgent.

Section 7 - Administration: Incident and.q: Where can you find an Incident Report to complete?
Section 7 - Administration: Incident and.a: On the Building Manager portal or in the operations office.

Section 7 - Administration: Incident and.q:
Which of the following should not be included in an Incident Report?
a. The time and date of the incident
b. Names and roles of individuals involved
c. The end result of the incident
d. An informed opinion of what those involved should have done differently
e. All of the above.
Section 7 - Administration: Incident and.a: d. An informed opinion of what those involved should have done differently

Section 8 - Scheduling and Hourly Report.q: True or False: If running behind schedule for a scheduled work shift, Building Managers should contact the Building Manager Supervisor so they can properly clock you into your shift.
If you need to drop a shift, what steps should you take?
Section 8 - Scheduling and Hourly Report.a: Submit the shift drop request on SubItUp and inform the supervisor.

Section 8 - Scheduling and Hourly Report.q: When and how do you submit an RTO?
Section 8 - Scheduling and Hourly Report.a: Submit through SubItUp at least two weeks in advance.

Section 10 - Event Management and Policy.q: A client arrives and states that they have a room reserved but you do not see it on the Setup Worksheet. How do you respond?
Section 10 - Event Management and Policy.a: Check the Event Master List or contact the Event Coordinator for clarification.

Section 10 - Event Management and Policy.q: A client would like to change details to their event that is taking place in the next three months. Where do you direct them?
True or False: Clients may post flyers, signs or decorations on the walls for decoration with scotch tape.
True or False: Check-in tables can be left outside of the meeting room or ballroom until the next scheduled event needs them.
If a client arrives at the Student Pavilion for a table reservation in the Mall, how do you assist the client?
Section 10 - Event Management and Policy.a: Check their reservation details and assist with setup if needed.

Section 10 - Event Management and Policy.q: Name the correct setup for each setup image (matching question).
Section 10 - Event Management and Policy.a: Answers will vary depending on images shown.

Section 10 - Event Management and Policy.q:
Which of the following is true about event changes?
a. Last minute changes can be only requested by the Event Coordinator
b. Last minute changes can be requested by the primary and secondary contact for the event as listed in the Setup Worksheet
c. Changes to an event may be requested at any point during the event as long as they are feasible
d. B and C

True or False: If the event change request is not possible, the Building Manager must inform the guest that we will not be able to provide the requested change but we will do our best to provide them with alternatives.
True or False: A Building Manager should always refresh the iPad to ensure that the latest information is reflected in the Setup Worksheet.
